item.title: Setting up Secure LDAP on Ubuntu 10.04 - the idiot's guide to SSL, TLS, and SLAPD
item.description: {% raw %} LDAP is one of the Elder Gods of the UNIX world.  It had it's beginnings in DAP, the first Directory Access Protocol, in 1988.  Within a decade DAP was more or less discarded in favor of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol.  And it has stayed in basically the same format ever since. LDAP is, as you might have guessed, a directory protocol.  It was developed in response to X.
